name: SELECT all columns from table
sql:
SELECT *
FROM table_name;

name: SELECT specific columns
sql:
SELECT column1, column2, column3
FROM table_name;

name: SELECT with WHERE filter
SELECT with ORDER BY
SELECT TOP/LIMIT rows
SELECT DISTINCT
sql:
SELECT DISTINCT column1
FROM table_name;

name: INSERT single row
sql:
INSERT INTO table_name (column1, column2, column3)
VALUES ('value1', 'value2', 123);

name: INSERT multiple rows
sql:
INSERT INTO table_name (column1, column2)
VALUES 
('value1', 'A'),
('value2', 'B'),
('value3', 'C');

name: UPDATE row(s)
DELETE row(s)
sql:
DELETE FROM table_name
WHERE id = 10;

name: CREATE new table
DROP table
sql: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS table_name;

name: RENAME table (sp_rename)
sql: EXEC sp_rename 'old_table_name', 'new_table_name';

name: ADD column to table
sql:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD new_column VARCHAR(50) NULL;

name: DROP column from table
sql:
ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_to_remove;

name: RENAME column (sp_rename)
sql: EXEC sp_rename 'table_name.old_column_name', 'new_column_name', 'COLUMN';

name: COUNT rows
sql:
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_rows
FROM table_name;

name: GROUP BY with COUNT
sql:
SELECT column1, COUNT(*) AS count
FROM table_name
GROUP BY column1
ORDER BY count DESC;

name: INNER JOIN two tables
LEFT JOIN
LIKE search
BETWEEN dates/numbers
CREATE simple stored procedure
EXECUTE stored procedure
sql: EXEC proc_name;

name: TRUNCATE table (delete all rows)
sql: TRUNCATE TABLE table_name;
